title: Show large stylish title message on second screen after Yes

requirements.text: Update the post-"Yes" flow so that after the user clicks "Yes! ðŸ’•", the app navigates to a distinct second screen (second page view within the same React app) that prominently displays the title text exactly: "NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU".

quotes:
Enter the title 
NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU 
On same web page in my project 
After going on sec page

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "Yes! ðŸ’•" button no longer ends on only the meme screen; the user can reach a second screen/view after "Yes".
The second screen/view displays the exact text "NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU" with no extra characters or different casing.
The second screen/view is rendered within the same deployed web app (no external navigation).

requirements.text: Style the title "NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU" in a visually "stylish alphabet" presentation suitable for a big screen (large hero typography, strong contrast, decorative but readable styling), while keeping all other user-facing text in English.

quotes:
Add name with stylish alphabet 
" NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU"

On big screen after pressing yes

acceptanceCriteria: On typical desktop widths, the title appears as the primary focal element and fits without clipping/overlap.
On mobile/tablet widths, the title remains readable (responsive sizing/line breaks) and stays centered.
All additional UI copy (buttons/labels) remains in English.

requirements.text: Provide a clear, simple way to proceed from the first post-Yes meme screen to the second title screen (e.g., a "Next"/"Continue" button), without breaking the existing romantic theme and background pattern.

quotes:
On same web page in my project 
After going on sec page

acceptanceCriteria: After clicking "Yes! ðŸ’•", the user sees the existing meme content and has an obvious control to proceed to the title screen.
The background pattern and romantic styling remain consistent across the prompt screen, meme screen, and title screen.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only Shadcn components).
Do not modify the immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them instead).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend work is required for this change.
nonGoals: Adding Internet Identity login requirements or any new backend persistence.
Adding third-party integrations or external navigation to another website.
Changing the existing required generated images (good-choice-meme and hearts-pattern background).
